meanings.definition: A person who spoils or corrupts something.
meanings.sent1: The vitiator of the group always caused trouble.
meanings.sent2: The vitiator's negative influence led to chaos.
meanings.sent3: The vitiator tried to ruin the surprise party but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her toxic behavior turned her into a vitiator of friendships.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the vitiator, for they bring destruction wherever they go.

meanings.definition: To spoil or impair the quality or efficiency of something.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the milk out too long will vitiator its freshness.
meanings.sent2: The rain threatened to vitiator our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally vitiator the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments vitiatored the positive atmosphere of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The virus can quickly vitiator a computer system if not protected.
